alert.note: Alert for Fresno; Madera; Mariposa; Merced; Tulare; Tuolumne (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued December 10 at 10:47PM PST by NWS Hanford
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 AM PST SUNDAY... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of central California and northern California, including the following counties, in central California, Fresno, Madera, Mariposa, Merced and Tulare. In northern California, Tuolumne. * WHEN...Until 500 AM PST Sunday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Rises in small streams and normally dry arroyos. River or stream flows are elevated. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1047 PM PST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Between 0.5 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Fresno, Clovis, Yosemite South Entrance, Sanger, Reedley, Oakhurst, Yosemite Lakes, Bootjack, Bonadelle Ranchos-Madera Ranchos, Mariposa, Coarsegold, Bass Lake Ranger District, Ahwahnee, Bass Lake, Crane Valley Reservoir, Batterson, North Fork, Metcalf Gap, Millerton Lake and Friant. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Move away from recently burned areas. Life-threatening flooding of creeks, roads and normally dry arroyos is likely. The heavy rains will likely trigger rockslides, mudslides and debris flows in steep terrain, especially in and around these areas.

area.areaDesc: Fresno; Madera; Mariposa; Merced; Tulare; Tuolumne
